text: Grmožur (Montenegrin Cyrillic: Грможур) is a fortified islet in Lake Skadar, located near the village of Godinje, in the Montenegrin municipality of Bar. The island was nicknamed the Island of Snakes by the local population, and the Island of Birds by ornithologists, since it is a common nesting site.Strategija razvoja kulturnog turizma Crne Gore sa Akcionim planom do 2023.godine ==Fortification== Fortification on the island was built by the Ottomans in 1843, and conquered by Montenegrins in 1878, following the Montenegrin–Ottoman War (1876–78). Shortly thereafter it was transformed into a prison island.Strategija razvoja kulturnog turizma Crne Gore sa Akcionim planom do 2023.godine == References == Category:Islands of Montenegro Category:Islands of Lake Skadar
title: Grmožur
